it.uniud.mads.jlibbig.core

Interface RewritingRule<A extends Bigraph<?>,B extends Bigraph<?>>

  • Type Parameters:
    A - The kind of bigraphs the rules applies to.
    B - The kind of bigraphs used for describing redex and reactum.
    All Superinterfaces:
    ReactionRule<A>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AgentRewritingRule, RewritingRule

    public interface RewritingRule<A extends Bigraph<?>,B extends Bigraph<?>>
extends ReactionRule<A>
    A rewriting rule is a reaction rule described by means of rewrites i.e. the reaction is a substitution of an occurrence (in the bigraph to which the rule is applied) of the rule's redex with the rule's reactum. Redex and reactum of a rewriting rule are described by means of two bigraphs (getRedex() and getReactum() ). Occurrences are described by matches (cf. Match) i.e. triples like where R is the redex occurrence and the bigraph P is the parameter. Then R is replaced by the reactum R' and P is instantiated to P' in order to match R' inner interface. Parameter instantiation is handled by instantiation rule returned by getInstantiationRule().
    See Also:
    RewritingSystem
